result.execSummary:
The defendant Dewayne Contreras was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court would consider early termination of probation at the recommendation of the Agent.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Any other condition deemed appropriate by Agent.  Any counseling deemed appropriate by Agent which may include treatment for Gambling.  No violent contact with Renee A.  DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dewayne Contreras

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Dewayne Contreras in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Dewayne Contreras in court with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek advises the Court the Defendant has completed treatment.  The Court reschedules the matter for plea and sentencing.  Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dewayne Contreras in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney Kershek advises the Court the Defendant is attending treatment and is scheduled to complete the treatment in about 5 weeks.  The Court sets the matter for disposition. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 18, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Dewayne Contreras in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek has received discovery and and offer and advises the Court the Defendant is enrolling in treatment.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Renee A.  Defendant to not gamble or enter any gambling casinos or any other business that gambling is the primary business.

Defendant Dewayne Contreras in court.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.    Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
